reviewText: I think these are excellent, the children love them at our library. I think these are excellent, the children love them at our library.

Bill makes science fun. This is one of my children's favorites because of a scene in which he points out that, in reality, all food comes from sunlight and dirt, and then goes to eat some dirt.

All the Bill Nye videos are funny and interesting, moving quickly from one aspect of the given topic to another, and repeating the most important parts over and over without getting annoying. Some of the sections are corney or dumb, but they are aware of this and laugh at themselves, which appeals to my kids.

All 4 of my children (13, 10, 6 and 3) adore the videos, and the older ones have picked up a great deal of science knowledge and understanding from the series. You can often rent them from the library, but we like them so much we have purchased them to watch over and over at home.
My kids love Bill Nye and they learn a lot from these videos.  The food web is particularly good at introducing a fairly complex idea but making it simple and accessible.
Bill is always great. My students always ask for his videos.
I use this video in my classroom for my food chain unit. I teach Science in Spanish, so I love that you can change the language and watch it in Spanish.  The kids love watching this video.
A little manic, which can be distracting for students.  I'd like to see a little less mania and a little more information.

I grew up watching Bill Nye and I'm so thrilled to see that my 3 year old is enjoying him, too! All of his DVD's are great. Interesting topics, creative experiments -- and a fun way for children to learn that science is everywhere!

I have bought several Bill Nye the Science Guy videos to use in my classroom. I teach 5 th grade but need to come up with ways to review the standards the students learned in 4 th grade. The students enjoy the videos and look forward to watching another Bill Nye video.
